intro: Scribaea divaricata, commonly known as the variegated scribaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with shades of green, yellow, and white. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often appearing in spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not commonly found in the wild outside its native range.
